Oh my god. My roommate does this ALL the time and it drives me crazy. He (probably) doesn't even care what I'm up to, but I don't want to feel obligated to invite him along or tell him where I am at all times of the day. It's fucking weird. Hmmm, I'm not certain. It seems pretty standard backpack size to me as compared to others I've used and seen. Sorry I can't be more helpful!

Haha even travelling with more than yourself is, well, a different experience. I love traveling with my SO but it is easier to snag a seat in the front row or in a carpool or on a train when you're just you!!

Yes, laundry every 4-5 days. Electronics-wise I just had my phone charger and my splurge item, a curling iron. My converter was about the size of half of a tic tac box, only $.99 from Hong Kong on ebay. For toiletries, I just used whatever when I stayed with friends aside from a tiny can of hairspray I bought. (Don't worry, I gifted them flowers for hosting)
I just went to visit some girlfriends. Not having to pack work clothes helps a bunch! I would absolutely recommend rolling clothes as this helps reduce wrinkles. Best of luck!

It made it so easy to travel! Not checking luggage is wonderful. It made plane, buses, cars, etc, very easy to get around in. My carpools were all pleasantly surprised at my lack of luggage. There was a time or two I had wished I brought more socks, because everything had to air dry and I did laundry every 4-5 days, but it was worth not having the extra weight. I did this 2 years ago for an 8 week trip and the hardest part is not picking up souvenirs!! Makes flying domestically (no baggage claim) a breeze too. :)

This was a couple months ago but to the best of my ability: 1 pair jeans, 1 pair yoga pants, 3 light tanks, 1 cardigan (matched with all tanks), 2 light shirts, 1 long sleeve neoprene shirt, 1 pajama tshirt, 1 pair pj shorts, 1 pair gym shoes, 1 pair boots, 1 winter coat (mostly worn the whole time!), 1 sports bra, 1 regular bra, few pairs (4-5?) of undies and warm socks, basic makeup, and (luxury item!) curling iron.
It comes with height ;) 10s aren't that bad!!

It does depend heavily on your district. My better half teaches in a town about 20 mins outside the city and the district, principal, dept, and fellow teachers are all wonderful to both him and to me (I substitute occasionally). We make more than the state we came from too, I believe you can find the chart online. Starts at 34k with a bachelor's and no experience (increases with experience and masters credits). We might stay forever because we've heard horror stories of other districts and this one has been a dream! Good luck to you!
Yes! I'll take the amazon compliment all day! Today I got asked how tall I was and was told it was "cheating" to wear heels. All the more height to tower over you, my dear.
These work particularly well if you leave a thumb-sized section uncovered in wax. I make bunches of these with candles every summer!

Flights with Norwegian can be crazy cheap but you have to fly out of NY or fl. Iceland air has lots of flights from denver direct. If you're willing to do a stopover in chicago or poland, flights can be crazy cheap through LOT Polish airlines as well. I saved over $1k on a trip I'm taking this spring. Good luck :)
Aka "the christmas hangover" for sales. Picking up year to year with gift cards though. Don't sweat it too much.

I used the Huron location too back when I had kaiser. I want to say it was donna Hollis and she was just very run-of-the-mill. I changed providers today cuz my year was up, I'm so thrilled to be away from Kaiser. If you want help finding a new plan once it's time, please feel free to write me a message and I'd be happy to help you navigate the madness. For now, good luck! :)

I'm going to make [these](http://ifoodreal.com/clean-baked-banana-nut-oatmeal-bars/) banana nut oatmeal bars, [these](http://leelalicious.com/pumpkin-breakfast-cookies/) pumpkin bars, and [these](http://smittenkitchen.com/blog/2010/02/thick-chewy-granola-bars/) thick chewy granola bars to start. I'm going to try to keep at least 1 fruit in rotation (for freshness's sake) and then maybe other not-AS-healthy but still not bad things now and then like beef jerky or cheese or chips. Good luck to you this semester! :)

I just went to zion last month. Hotels are crazy cheap in the off season. Think 2 queens for about $50. If ya have 4 people that rivels some campsites for sure! I understand it's not the same as camping but it's still nice as a backup if you're traveling with a newbie. I think one of the places we stayed was in panguitch UT. Springdale is also cool and close to the parks.
I do postcards. Cheap and lightweight.
Great ideas! Thank you! :)

WRITING.TITLE: Snack ideas for teacher without a break (6+ hours)
WRITING.TEXT: Hi! I'm looking for ideas for recipes like [this](http://ifoodreal.com/clean-baked-banana-nut-oatmeal-bars/) to make for my better half because for some reason, his schedule allows for him to each his "lunch" at either 10am or 4pm. He does have a few minutes between classes to snag a snack, though, and I thought it might be nice to pack a few "lunches" that consist of 5-6 small easy-quick-to-eat, not-a-big-mess snacks. These bars I could make a bunch in advance, other than that I'll try to throw fruit or something in as well. Any suggestions greatly appreciated! :)
Hey fellow athlete, I'm looking for a vball team in the spring, planning on putting one together myself for the summer if you're interested!
What do you sell? Interested in selling wholesale?
There's a fb group for r/denverwomen as well. Might have better luck with short term stuff there. Hope to see ya around!
Pilots going over iceland refer to it as e15, for its 15 letters

I have a membership at denver parks and rec, some locations (like stapleton) have classes for a small additional fee. It's peanuts $$wise compared to core power or any other downtown studios. I'd love to do some yoga with ya!
Right! I love this sub. :D

Check out denver parks and rec. 16 gyms throughout the city and $20/month. There are different levels of membership. Some are pretty bare, the one by me has 1 treadmill, 1 bike, and 1 elliptical..but they do have a weight room and a pool. The Stapleton one, however, off mlk has a giant pool and dozens of machines and multiple weight rooms. I'll try to link ya (I'm on mobile). Happy working out! :)
Maybe the comments are ;)

After studying a multitude of languages, I've found that it's best to learn (start) another language once I have a pretty solid base in those languages I have/had studied previously. When I studied Swedish and Italian at the same time my brain would mix them up. However, after learning Spanish for a few years, then german for a few years, then french for a few years...they had separate places in my head and it was easy to keep them separate.
Shoot me a text if ya don't mind repeats or you need a filler! :)

WRITING.TITLE: Stem Ciders - Thurs, June 11th
WRITING.TEXT:
Yo, ladies, about time for a meetup! Stem Ciders seemed like a good choice because they offer a variety of dry ciders. "Dry" as in, you can drink more than a sip without it being too sweet! They're really well done.
I can bring games again if ya want. 6 Nimmt is always a good one, any other easy-to-learn stuff might be good as well! Who's got suspend? And, as always, if anyone wants to euchre, I'm all hands in....
ALSO OF NOTE, a certain Denver lady is in town after a leave of absence so this seemed like a perfect excuse to meet. ;)
Facebook group [here](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1017805674912603/) and event [here](https://www.facebook.com/events/1117359594957424/)
I would love to help! Yay crafts and weddings!

WRITING.TITLE: Calling all Denver ladies! Bookmark May 14th on your calendars.
WRITING.TEXT:
It's been a while since the last meetup. We're planning to do a little get together with the ladies of Denver at Bicycle cafe. We do have our secret little subreddit [here](http://www.reddit.com/r/denverwomen) as well as a facebook group [here](https://www.facebook.com/groups/1017805674912603/), for those of you that would like to join either of those outlets. There are a couple barriers to entry for privacy's sake, but please don't be discouraged!
This shindig will take place May 14th. More details on our sub and our facebook group. [Event details here](https://www.facebook.com/events/789071601199805/)
This is just a simple meet and greet. I will be bringing a board game or two, in case there's a couple nerds out there. No knowledge required...no redditing required either. If your other half would like to meet other ladies, please pass the invite along. Hoping to meet some cool people!
If you wouldn't mind throwing an upvote my way for the sake of visibility, that would be much appreciated.

WRITING.TITLE: Meetup Time! It's gonna be May!
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi ladies,
We haven't had a meetup in a bit. Let's do this.
Thursday, May 14th. 6pm. Bicycle Cafe off 17th and Lafayette.
Maybe one of us will bring a board game? Maybe that someone will be me!
sure thing!

maybe try looking for an au pair. [www.aupairworld.net](http://www.aupairworld.net). many times you can get someone who will pay their own airfare, you'd just have a live-in and pay a meager salary of ~$100/week. i know i worked for 50/60 per week a few years ago. most are looking for the experience of living abroad.

If you need a shower and/or some company while you're passing through Denver, shoot me a message. My husband and I are big on camping--and I know we definitely had a few pit stops at friends' places to clean up and feel like humans! :)
well done
Cool, registered. See you then!

so, i have a funny question: i want to go but i'm super broke. i don't want to 'take advantage' of being able to pay an arbitrary amount, but i really would like to attend this meetup. do you have a suggestion for the 'breaking point'?

I'm not sure if everyone can make an event who is a part of the Facebook group but I'd be happy to change it to give you (and whoever else is interested) the ability to create events so we can have reminders :)
